description: Patterns for customer retention, satisfaction, and engagement issues including churn detection, retention problems, and satisfaction decline

patterns.name: Customer Churn Detection
patterns.description: Detects issues related to customer attrition, churn rate increases, and customer loss patterns

hypotheses.statement: Customers may be churning due to perceived lack of value relative to {{primarySubject}} pricing or competitor offerings
investigationSteps: Survey churned customers about reasons for leaving using structured exit interviews
Compare feature usage patterns between retained and churned customers
Analyze pricing tier distribution of churned customers vs retained
Review competitor analysis and feature parity gaps
Calculate customer lifetime value (CLV) by segment
expectedFindings: Low feature adoption among churned customers (<30% feature utilization)
Price sensitivity mentioned in 40%+ of exit surveys
Competitor mentions in cancellation reasons
Churned customers concentrated in specific pricing tiers
CLV declining over recent cohorts

hypotheses.statement: Poor onboarding experience may be causing early-stage customer churn for {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Analyze time-to-first-value metrics for churned vs retained customers
Review onboarding completion rates by cohort and acquisition channel
Identify drop-off points in onboarding funnel using analytics
Compare onboarding duration between churned and retained users
Review support tickets during onboarding period
expectedFindings: High churn rate in first 30 days (>15% of total churn)
Low onboarding completion rates (<60%)
Specific onboarding steps with >30% abandonment
Longer time-to-first-value for churned customers
High support ticket volume during onboarding

hypotheses.statement: Product-market fit issues may be causing customers to churn as {{primarySubject}} doesn't meet their core needs
investigationSteps: Segment churned customers by use case and industry
Analyze feature requests from churned customers
Review product usage patterns before churn
Conduct win/loss analysis on recent churns
Compare product capabilities with customer expectations
expectedFindings: Churn concentrated in specific customer segments
Common feature gaps mentioned by churned customers
Low engagement with core product features
Mismatch between marketed capabilities and actual product
Customers switching to competitors with specific features

hypotheses.statement: Product complexity may be overwhelming customers and driving churn for {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Analyze feature usage breadth vs depth for churned customers
Review user interface complexity and navigation patterns
Examine support ticket themes related to confusion or difficulty
Compare power user vs casual user churn rates
Assess documentation and help resource utilization
expectedFindings: Churned customers using fewer features than retained
High bounce rates on complex feature pages
Support tickets mentioning confusion or difficulty
Higher churn among users who don't complete tutorials
Low help documentation engagement before churn

recommendations.action: Implement structured exit surveys for all churning customers to understand {{primarySubject}} churn drivers
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Quantified reasons for churn with actionable categories and trends

recommendations.action: Perform cohort analysis to identify churn patterns by acquisition channel, plan type, and customer segment
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Identification of high-risk customer segments and churn predictors

recommendations.action: Build a churn prediction model to identify at-risk customers before they leave
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Early warning system for at-risk customers with 70%+ accuracy

recommendations.action: Redesign onboarding flow to reduce friction and accelerate time-to-value
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Increased onboarding completion rate by 20-40% and reduced early churn

recommendations.action: Implement proactive customer success outreach for at-risk customers
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Reduced churn rate by 15-30% through proactive intervention

recommendations.action: Launch win-back campaigns targeting recently churned customers

patterns.name: Customer Retention Issues
patterns.description: Detects problems with customer retention strategies, engagement decline, and loyalty program effectiveness

hypotheses.statement: Customer engagement may be declining over time leading to retention issues for {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Analyze product usage trends over customer lifecycle
Track login frequency and session duration by cohort
Review feature adoption curves for different customer segments
Measure engagement score trends over time
Identify engagement drop-off points in customer journey
expectedFindings: Declining login frequency after initial period
Reduced feature usage over time
Engagement scores dropping before renewal periods
Specific lifecycle stages with engagement cliffs
Correlation between low engagement and non-renewal

hypotheses.statement: Customers may not be realizing ongoing value from {{primarySubject}} after initial implementation
investigationSteps: Track key value metrics customers should achieve
Compare expected vs actual outcomes for customers
Review customer success milestone completion rates
Analyze correlation between value metrics and retention
Survey customers about perceived value over time
expectedFindings: Customers not achieving expected ROI or outcomes
Low completion of value-driving milestones
Declining perceived value in customer surveys
Gap between promised and delivered value
Strong correlation between value metrics and retention

hypotheses.statement: Insufficient or ineffective customer communication may be causing retention issues for {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Audit customer communication touchpoints and frequency
Analyze email open rates and engagement metrics
Review customer feedback on communication preferences
Compare communication patterns for retained vs churned customers
Assess personalization level of customer communications
expectedFindings: Low email open and click-through rates
Infrequent proactive communication
Generic messaging not tailored to customer needs
Missing communication at critical lifecycle moments
Customer complaints about communication quality

hypotheses.statement: Poor support experience may be eroding customer loyalty and retention for {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Analyze support ticket resolution times and satisfaction scores
Review support interaction history for churned customers
Track support escalation rates and patterns
Compare support experience metrics with retention rates
Assess self-service resource effectiveness
expectedFindings: Long resolution times for support tickets
Low CSAT scores for support interactions
High escalation rates indicating first-contact resolution issues
Churned customers had more negative support experiences
Underutilized or ineffective self-service resources

recommendations.action: Implement comprehensive customer engagement monitoring and health scoring for {{primarySubject}}
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Real-time visibility into customer engagement levels and early warning for at-risk accounts

recommendations.action: Design and implement lifecycle marketing campaigns to maintain engagement at key stages
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Improved engagement at critical lifecycle moments and reduced drop-off

recommendations.action: Establish customer value tracking to measure and communicate ROI to customers
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Customers understand and can articulate value received

recommendations.action: Implement or optimize customer loyalty and rewards program
Establish quarterly business review program for key accounts
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Stronger relationships and proactive issue identification

recommendations.action: Improve support quality through training, tooling, and process optimization
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Higher CSAT scores and faster resolution times

patterns.name: Customer Satisfaction Decline
patterns.description: Detects declining customer satisfaction, NPS drops, and negative sentiment trends

hypotheses.statement: Product quality issues including bugs, performance problems, or reliability may be driving satisfaction decline for {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Analyze bug reports and error rates over time
Review performance metrics and degradation trends
Correlate product issues with satisfaction score changes
Examine support tickets for product-related complaints
Track uptime and reliability metrics
expectedFindings: Increased bug reports or error rates
Performance degradation correlating with NPS drops
Product issues mentioned in detractor feedback
Reliability incidents impacting customer experience
Technical debt affecting user experience

hypotheses.statement: Gap between customer expectations and actual experience may be causing satisfaction decline for {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Compare marketing promises with product capabilities
Analyze sales process and expectation setting
Review onboarding materials for accuracy
Survey customers about expectation vs reality
Examine feedback themes from detractors
expectedFindings: Marketing claims not fully supported by product
Sales overselling capabilities
Customers expecting features not available
Disconnect between demo and actual product
Detractor feedback mentioning unmet expectations

hypotheses.statement: Poor support experience may be a primary driver of customer dissatisfaction for {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Analyze support satisfaction scores (CSAT) trends
Review response and resolution time metrics
Examine support interaction quality through audits
Correlate support experiences with NPS responses
Identify common support pain points
expectedFindings: Declining support CSAT scores
Increasing response or resolution times
Quality issues in support interactions
Strong correlation between support experience and NPS
Recurring support issues not being addressed

hypotheses.statement: Poor communication or lack of transparency may be eroding customer trust and satisfaction for {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Review communication during incidents or changes
Analyze customer feedback about communication
Assess transparency in pricing and policy changes
Examine proactive vs reactive communication patterns
Survey customers about communication preferences
expectedFindings: Customers surprised by changes or issues
Feedback mentioning poor communication
Lack of proactive updates during incidents
Unclear or confusing messaging
Trust erosion due to perceived lack of transparency

recommendations.action: Implement comprehensive NPS program with regular surveys and closed-loop feedback for {{primarySubject}}
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Continuous visibility into customer satisfaction with actionable feedback

recommendations.action: Conduct deep-dive analysis of detractor feedback to identify root causes
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Categorized and prioritized list of satisfaction drivers

recommendations.action: Implement closed-loop feedback process to follow up with detractors and address concerns
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Improved detractor recovery rate and actionable insights

recommendations.action: Prioritize product quality improvements based on customer feedback
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Reduced product-related complaints and improved satisfaction

recommendations.action: Align marketing, sales, and product messaging to set accurate expectations
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Reduced expectation gaps and improved initial satisfaction

recommendations.action: Improve customer communication with proactive updates and transparency
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Increased customer trust and reduced surprise-driven dissatisfaction

recommendations.action: Establish customer advisory board to gather ongoing feedback and build relationships
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Deeper customer relationships and early warning on satisfaction issues
